segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection settings
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection settings

segment.source: Use the menu to configure the time zone, suppression rules, and view license information.
segment.target: Use the menu to configure the time zone, suppression rules, and view license information.

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection settings
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection settings

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: Use the Settings menu Settings icon to configure the time zone, suppression rules, and view license information.
segment.target: Use the Settings menu Settings icon to configure the time zone, suppression rules, and view license information.

segment.source: Time zone settings
segment.target: Time zone settings

segment.source: The aspect of time is important in the assessment and analysis of perceived and actual cyberattacks.
segment.target: The aspect of time is important in the assessment and analysis of perceived and actual cyberattacks.

segment.source: Cyberforensic investigations often rely on time stamps to piece together the sequence of events.
segment.target: Cyberforensic investigations often rely on time stamps to piece together the sequence of events.

segment.source: It’s important that your system reflects the correct time zone settings.
segment.target: It’s important that your system reflects the correct time zone settings.

segment.source: Windows Defender ATP can display either Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or local time.
segment.target: Windows Defender ATP can display either Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or local time.

segment.source: Your current time zone setting is shown in the Windows Defender ATP menu.
segment.target: Your current time zone setting is shown in the Windows Defender ATP menu.

segment.source: You can change the displayed time zone in the Settings menu Settings icon.
segment.target: You can change the displayed time zone in the Settings menu Settings icon.

segment.source: UTC time zone
segment.target: UTC time zone

segment.source: Windows Defender ATP uses UTC time by default.
segment.target: Windows Defender ATP uses UTC time by default.

segment.source: Setting the Windows Defender ATP time zone to UTC will display all system timestamps (alerts, events, and others) in UTC for all users.
segment.target: Setting the Windows Defender ATP time zone to UTC will display all system timestamps (alerts, events, and others) in UTC for all users.

segment.source: Choosing this setting means that all users will see the same timestamps in Windows Defender ATP, regardless of their regional settings.
segment.target: Choosing this setting means that all users will see the same timestamps in Windows Defender ATP, regardless of their regional settings.

segment.source: This can help security analysts working in different locations across the globe to use the same time stamps while investigating events.
segment.target: This can help security analysts working in different locations across the globe to use the same time stamps while investigating events.

segment.source: Local time zone
segment.target: Local time zone

segment.source: You can choose to have Windows Defender ATP use local time zone settings.
segment.target: You can choose to have Windows Defender ATP use local time zone settings.

segment.source: All alerts and events will be displayed using your local time zone.
segment.target: All alerts and events will be displayed using your local time zone.

segment.source: The local time zone is taken from your machine’s regional settings.
segment.target: The local time zone is taken from your machine’s regional settings.

segment.source: If you change your regional settings, the Windows Defender ATP time zone will also change.
segment.target: If you change your regional settings, the Windows Defender ATP time zone will also change.

segment.source: Choosing this setting means that the timestamps displayed in Windows Defender ATP will be aligned to local time for all Windows Defender ATP users.
segment.target: Choosing this setting means that the timestamps displayed in Windows Defender ATP will be aligned to local time for all Windows Defender ATP users.

segment.source: Analysts located in different global locations will now see the Windows Defender ATP alerts according to their regional settings.
segment.target: Analysts located in different global locations will now see the Windows Defender ATP alerts according to their regional settings.

segment.source: Choosing to use local time can be useful if the analysts are located in a single location.
segment.target: Choosing to use local time can be useful if the analysts are located in a single location.

segment.source: In this case it might be easier to correlate events to local time, for example – when a local user clicked on a suspicious email link.
segment.target: In this case it might be easier to correlate events to local time, for example – when a local user clicked on a suspicious email link.

segment.source: Set the time zone
segment.target: Set the time zone

segment.source: The Windows Defender ATP time zone is set by default to UTC.
segment.target: The Windows Defender ATP time zone is set by default to UTC.

segment.source: Setting the time zone also changes the times for all Windows Defender ATP views.
segment.target: Setting the time zone also changes the times for all Windows Defender ATP views.

segment.source: To set the time zone:
segment.target: To set the time zone:

segment.source: Click the Settings menu Settings icon.
segment.target: Click the Settings menu Settings icon.

segment.source: Select the Timezone:UTC indicator.
segment.target: Select the Timezone:UTC indicator.

segment.source: The time zone indicator changes to Timezone:Local.
segment.target: The time zone indicator changes to Timezone:Local.

segment.source: Click it again to change back to Timezone:UTC.
segment.target: Click it again to change back to Timezone:UTC.

segment.source: Suppression rules
segment.target: Suppression rules

segment.source: The suppression rules control what alerts are suppressed.
segment.target: The suppression rules control what alerts are suppressed.

segment.source: You can suppress alerts so that certain activities are not flagged as suspicious.
segment.target: You can suppress alerts so that certain activities are not flagged as suspicious.

segment.source: See Suppress alerts.
segment.target: See Suppress alerts.

segment.source: License
segment.target: License

segment.source: Click the license link in the Settings menu to view the license agreement information for Windows Defender ATP.
segment.target: Click the license link in the Settings menu to view the license agreement information for Windows Defender ATP.
